It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are ovate and have a velvety texture, while its stems are covered in fine hairs. Oberna schottiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
